reviews.text: Loved the room, view, beach, pool, food and everything else you can think of....but the best part of the trip was our session with the Relaxation Specialist, Charles Mill. He has a program called Masters of Relaxation and if you truly open your mind, the possibilities for improving your lifestyle habits are endless!
reviews.title: Masters of Relaxation

reviews.text: We were more than happy with our stay. The staff were very welcoming, friendly and helpful. We are especially thankful for Armando, Braulio, Carlos and Delfina, because they always knew our name, and remembered what we liked to have at the breakfast buffet. The breakfast buffet was delicious with a variety of choices and good value for money. When we looked at previous reviews, some had said that the construction work was very noisy but we never found this to be the case. We would also recommend that you ask at kids club about the turtles hatching because when we visited we were lucky enough to help release the turtles into the sea. The beach was beautiful and a relaxing experience and the massages in the beach hut were the best we've ever had. The sea was rough at times but still very warm. Not only that, but the pool was very clean and never got busy. There were 2 hot tubs which were big and lovely to relax in. There's hammocks on site and rabbits in the kids club and you should definitely join in when they feed the iguanas which is at 11am on most days. unfortunately the weather turned and the 'rina' hurricane was estimated to hit us at full speed, but eventually died down into a small tropical storm. The rooms were beautiful and plenty of space, all balconies had a stunning view and great for photos. The bed was huge and the pillows were the best ones i've slept on. We had dinner at the hotel restaurant one time, we weren't very impressed as it was expensive and wasn't that great; But there were so many other options to eat at it didn't even matter and we would recommend - la madonna, la habichuela, la elefanta and thai (which were next to each other and had tables by the lagoon and ask the waiters to see the crocodiles that live in the lagoon). There we had tasty meals and good service and were all within walking distance as there were many restaurants in the shopping mall and lots with a 5 minute walk to. There were plenty of shops to go to on rainy days. There is also a small shop at the lower floor with limited stock but most essential items which was handy.
reviews.title: Stunning resort, would love to visit again!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We would love to go back and experience more of Mexico and the friendly people.
reviews.title: Just got home from a great holiday in Cancun Mexico

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We just got home after staying a week at the Westin. It is a beautiful resort. The staff are bar none the most helpful. We did end up going to a time share meeting but it was something we wanted to know more about. We ate at both the restaurants on site and the lunch one was really good. The one that serves breakfast and dinner we only ate at once because there are such great places to eat in Cancun. If you love great food, sun and surf and great accommodations choose this! There is construction going on because they are building an additional building and working on the main building as well. When we were irritated by the noise level we went to the beach and that solved that issue. You might want to wait until all this work is done.
reviews.title: Everything I could have wanted!

reviews.text: We ate at the following places while we were there. Harry's a steak house food was excellent but pricey. When you order there you have to order all your sides separately, in fact most places you have to.
reviews.title: An encounter with a Relaxation specialist Charles Mills

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our stay 17APR - 23APR2013
reviews.title: Relaxing

reviews.text: We took advantage of the shuttle service offered by the hotel. Upon check-in we were assigned a room in the 200 bldg, 2nd floor. I asked for a higher floor and we were switched to the 700 bldg, 7th floor. All buildings have a sea view. The hotel was very nice with beautiful pools and beachfront.
reviews.title: Great, convenient and top of the line hotel

reviews.text: We are European/Eastern Europe/Mediterranean travelers. It was our first time to Mexico. We thoroughly enjoyed our vacation at the Westin Lagunamar and are planning another trip next year.
reviews.title: Excellent spot!

reviews.text: We're budget minded travelers. Knowing our unit had a full kitchen I brought my large Carrefour shopping bag for our Walmart excursion. Take the R2, 8.5 pesos, 30min from the hotel zone to Walmart. Walmart has everything including beer, wine, liquor, souvenirs. Great produce section.
reviews.title: Westin Lagunamar, Cancun

reviews.text: We also purchased some groceries at the small market at the Westin. The prices were reasonable.
reviews.title: Fabulous vacation spot!

reviews.text: Other than a tricky layout there is not much to fault with this well situated beachfront timeshare/hotel on the Cancun beach. Nice choice of restaurants on site with La Isla mall just across the street, nice infinity pool, good list of daily activities and great local help from the concierges.
reviews.title: The perfect spot in Cancun

reviews.text: We just got back April 15th wanted to write in before we forgot ... Mid 30s couple have done lots of all inclusive a I liked this sooo much better then being herded in at specific times to eat. Their breakfast buffet was awesome rooms equipped with everything you need to cook with and even a blender with an"icy drink" function lol
reviews.title: Perfect place for families and couples
Love it...but dripping vent on hubby's breakfast.Oceano
reviews.text: The first day we were lazy and got lunch in the resort and also were shocked by our 80$ tab at lunch 20$ club sandwiched 10$ drinks highly suggest getting your own food at Walmart or SAMs club the mini mart in the hotel is overpriced and the liquor across the street at la isla total rip off 3x price at Walmart

Just take the bus .75$ so easy 15min to Walmart and cab back 14$ we got homemade salsa they were making in isle so good nacho chips made there mangos papayas homemade bread eggs and yummy cheeses ... And alcohol ofcourse ... Awesome drink to make in your room fresh papaya cocunut rum pinapple juice ice blender drink soooo good and fridges in rooms come with your own ice machine
reviews.title: As close to perfect for families as it gets!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We lived the convinces of this resort very clean service was slow so recommend getting your own beverages ... This is a resort for families and couples a lot of single groups of guys and girls stated it was not what they expected... We loved it no loud pumping bad 1980s music cd on replay all day like other resorts easy to get lounge chairs no annoying announcements every hour just pure relaxation
reviews.title: Everything is excellent

reviews.text: Let's start with the one major con so that it doesn't get lost in this review. The wifi, which was provided free of charge, was unbearably slow and unreliable. The connection was worse in certain rooms and during prime usage times. Certain apps would not work and connection constantly dropped. LAN cable on room didn't work when I tried to connect my laptop. Management claimed to be aware of the problem and working on a solution. I didn't see a change in the three days I was there. Maybe it was better that I disconnected an enjoyed why Cancun has to offer. So now for my review...
reviews.title: Great hotel and beach - minor issue noted
Great stay with minor hiccups
reviews.text: There hotel is located about 25 minutes from the Cancun airport and across the street from a nice mall with food and grocery options. At the hotel, there is a bright, open lobby with views of the pools and ocean which provides a wonderful welcome. There are many concierge staff able and willing to help. I especially liked the airport transfer feature ($79usd round trip). There are three restaurants with great food. The breakfast buffet is enormous, but pricey at $30usd. If you plan to eat a lot it is well worth the cost, which includes bottomless mimosas. Wide array of fruits, pastries, breads, eggs, bacon, waffles, pancakes, omelette station and the list goes on!!! A little disappointing that espresso or bottled water is not included. The food I ate for lunch and dinner was also good and not too pricey, but the menu is limited. There are many pools and hot tubs and beautiful fountains. There is a magnificent infinity pool overlooking the ocean, with a swim-up bar. There are lots of lounge chairs and umbrellas around the pools and many waiters taking orders. There is a kiddie pool and a slide too. Very family oriented with lots of activities. The concierge try to organize volleyball and football (soccer) games on the beach too. The beach is pristine and well guarded by lifeguards so you feel safe. Free lounge chairs which is great! The hotel offers a spa, fitness center and business center.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My room was comfortable with a balcony and great view of the ocean. I stayed in Tower 10. It was a one-bedroom with a full kitchen, dining room and living room. There was also a washer and dryer in the room! My only issue with the room was that some outlets did not work, the electricity surge seemed low as devices took forever to charge and there were many many many switches for the lights that were sometimes confusing to identify.
reviews.title: Another great visit!

reviews.text: All in all, it was a great stay and I recommend the hotel if you can deal with the small issues I mentioned above.
reviews.title: Best spot in Cancun

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall we had a wonderful stay and would definitely come back. Top notch service from the entire staff, great restaurants and excellent location (25 minutes or so from airport). But, there were two small hiccups we encountered: 1. We barely had hot water ( thankfully its hot outside so cold showers weren't a major inconvienece) but annoying no less. Also the wifi was non existent in our room and overall very spotty throughout the hotel. Even though there was a business center it was annoying not having wifi for my iPad to check up on things. Either way, if we come back to Cancun, we will be back to this Westin.
reviews.title: Loved it!

reviews.text: This is my third visit to this hotel. All of my past visits were wonderful. The start of this stay was a little rockey. The first room that I was put in was very dirty and not at all to the standards of a Westin hotel. I did notify one of the hotel managers Aida who was able to resolve my issues, it did take some time, and upgraded my room. The rest of the stay was as wonderful as ever!
reviews.title: They say the third times the charm!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We usually come to vacation here in early April. Weather is fantastic. We have never had a bad day. Westin Lagunamar is the ultimate with regard to service with a smile. We often venture off property and feel very safe. We never rent a car because everything is an easy walk or short inexpensive bus ride away. We have visited at least 15 Caribbean beach resorts and this is the winner hands down.
reviews.title: 4th Time Back - Awesome
Excellent Resort
reviews.text: This is our third time and being owners we really love this place. Staff is excellent and we were automatically upgraded to a room in the new tower right over the beach. Great pools, beach is gorgeous and a great location. Made our trip the first day to Walmart for supplies. We usually take the bus but the concierge had a coupon for a taxi ($350 pesos) round trip and he waited an hour for us to shop. Great way to start a week's vacation. Tried 2 new restaurants: La Destileria and Captain's Cove. Great Mexican and seafood restaurants and walking distance. All in all great getaway resort!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I spent six nights at the Westin Lagunamar two weeks ago. I chose the resort mainly because it is NOT all inclusive. We like the freedom to find good restaurants and leave the resort. Other factors were the full kitchen, washer/dryer in unit, and that all units have balconies.
reviews.title: No complaints at all

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Westin Lagunamar did not disappoint. It was nice to be picked up in a Chevy Suburban arranged by the hotel instead of having to ride in a van with six other couples and stopping at several different hotels. This was arranged by our concierge prior to our arrival and cost the same as purchasing round trip transportation though Expedia. Check in was relatively easy. Our room was not ready upon arrival at 130pm but I did not expect it would be as check in is 4pm. So we went to the pool restaurant and had lunch and drinks. Our room was ready at 330pm as promised. We were asked if we wanted to go to the time share presentation for a $100 resort credit and we declined with no further pressure.
reviews.title: Home sweet home.

reviews.text: The Lagunamar is a lovely resort - the staff is friendly, the pool and grounds are very nice, and there are plenty of amenities. The breakfast buffet was excellent and had a nice variety - we ate there 3 days in a row and paid 3 different rates. I reckon it pays to be nice to your waiter! We were in building 900, so we did not get to see the resort - instead we got construction sights and sounds from 6:30am to 6:30pm every day. The studio room is tiny - way too small for any family and the cooking facilities are a joke - there's no place to sit. If you want to cook, trade up for a bigger 1BR room. We got the timeshare pitch and it was a good one - I appreciated that they didn't put the hard sell on! We'd love to go back and maybe not listen to jackhammers all day! A special hint - eat at Chilis across the street. Prices are reasonable and the staff was fantastic!
reviews.title: Lovely Resort in most respects!

reviews.text: I enjoyed a recent stay at the Westin Lagunamar Resort in Cancun, Mexico. One of the best programs of the resort is the Masters of Relaxation program with renowned Charlie Mills. This program that he and assistant Fernanda put on is a truly unique and eye opening experience. Can't wait to go back to this hotel and this 5 star wellness program again!
reviews.title: Wellness Program was Superb!

reviews.text: Just got back from a "girl's weekend" trip to Cancun. The hotel was great regardless of the construction that was on-going at either building 8 or 9. We had amazing ocean and resort views. Great breakfast at Oceana, good snacks by the pool, but the drinks could have used more umph! We also talked to the Master of Relaxation - Charlie and Fernanda. We had a private session with the masters and learned tidbits about relaxation, stress management, and sacred geometry....a great learning hour....well worth the time and money!
reviews.title: Awesome break from the daily grind

reviews.text: If you are traveling to Cancun, the Westin Lagunamar is a perfect place to stay. The hotel is large with nice rooms all with ocean views. We had two rooms, a studio on the 6th floor directly in the middle of the property. WoW! What an amazing view! The second room was a one bedroom on the second floor. The view was not as amazing as the 6th floor, but it was still a great view and the suite was very very nice. This property is not just a hotel but a resort. The staff is very helpful, ready to provide you with information, directions, maps, and prices. The swim up bar is a great place to hang out, the servers were very nice and fun. Everyone speaks English and will go the mile to make you feel welcome and happy. Only downside were the sleeper sofas, my sons said they were uncomfortable.
reviews.title: Magnificent Resort

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great resort with good facilities and staffs. There is a big mall right across the street from the hotel and if you walk down little bit from the mall, good liquor store with great prices, and convenient store. Good thing about this resort if that you can cook in the room when you are tired of eating out. We took a bus to downtown for a grocery shopping.
reviews.title: Nice resort with a great view

reviews.text: We stayed four nights in a studio suite (villa). We appreciated the helpful, friendly English-speaking staff, the beautiful views of the ocean and the fantastic pool with a waterslide for the kids. We used the dishwasher and fully appointed kitchen and washer and dryer. The staff helped us choose two excursions - XCaret and Isla des Mejeures. XCaret was perfect for our family. Isla des Mejeures was a little rundown, but interesting. We did take the timeshare tour to save money on the XCaret excursion (it was expensive), and it was moderately high-pressure. The sales executive was super friendly until we declined the offer; then he simply left us in the dust. It would seem he would keep the relationship going in the hope that we would eventually come to his way of thinking.
reviews.title: We Loved It

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had always been hesitant about visiting Mexico because of all the fears involved. We were most pleasantly surprised and pleased about our week just spent in Cancun.
reviews.title: our Cancun vacation

reviews.text: Tourism is the life's blood of this city, and everyone shows it. From Hola! to how is your day, how are you enjoying Cancun etc it was a wonderful experience.
reviews.title: Absolutely worth it!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Westin as well as all of Cancun was wonderful, clean, and friendly.
reviews.title: Perfect vacation experience

reviews.text: If you belong to II or Starwood visit the Lagunamar.
reviews.title: Westin Lagunamar out of this world Wellness experience.
Best pool and excellent value
reviews.text: Family of 4 (daughters ages 9 and 11) enjoyed 5 nights over Thanksgiving 2011. Infinity pool and beach access were terrific. Most days, pool side chairs were available until 9:30. Some shady spots available. Towels are available starting at 8am. Kids enjoyed the water slide and the huge pools, which are max 4 feet deep. 2 hot tubs that were very hot. Bathrooms available on both sides of the pools and it wasn't more than a 5 minute hike back up to the room if you forget something.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Beach was nice. There is a sandbar on the left side of the property that allows you to go out around 40 yards to body surf. In other spots, there is a fairly steep drop off right off the beach. Ample beach chairs available on the sand, but limited shade.
reviews.title: Worse than we expected!

reviews.text: Food and drink service poolside were very attentive. First day, we purchased 4 sandwiches from the market downstairs and it came out to around $18. Two other days we bought hot lunches from the poolside restaurant. Club sandwich and fish tacos were both good and priced around $12 each, and 1/2 pound hamburger was very filling at $15.
reviews.title: Fun Times!

reviews.text: Minor construction on both sides of property in late November 2011. They are in the middle of refinishing some of the square "arches" on both sides of the property and there was some construction noise during the middle of the day. Major construction on Phase 2 is mostly completed and wasn't an issue. We were in building 7, right next to the new phase, and noise was never an issue.
reviews.title: Great place for everyone.

reviews.text: Rooms are excellent. We had a 1 bedroom and the kids slept on the sofa bed. The rooms feel new and clean. Plenty of drawers and storage space. The kitchen is well equipped (with full fridge, 4 burners, microwave, dishwasher) and the bathroom is large, with double sinks and a large jacuzzi tub and separate shower. Washer and dryer are in the hallway and a very nice thing to have on vacation. Also nice to have a dining table that seats 6. Each room has an outdoor patio with seating for 4.
reviews.title: Welcome to the USSR!
